Deprecated List

Member Connect::das ()
Use the method which takes a DAS reference as a value-result parameter.

Member Connect::dds ()
Use the method which takes a DDS references as a value-result parameter.

Member Connect::error ()
The new methods for getting DAS, DDS, et .c, objects throw Error objects; if you use those methods, and you should, this is never needed.

Member Connect::gui ()
The GUI is no longer supported. This always returns null.

Member Error::correct_error (void *gui) const
The error-correction program feature is deprecated.

Member Error::display_message (void *gui=0) const
Use get_error_message() instead.

Member Error::error_code (ErrorCode ec=undefined_error)
Use the set/get methods instead.

Member Error::error_message (string msg="")
Use the set/get methods instead.

Member Error::get_program () const
The error-correction program feature is deprecated.

Member Error::get_program_type () const
The error-correction program feature is deprecated.

Member Error::print (ostream &os=cout) const
Use the FILE * version instead.

Member Error::program (char *program=0)
The error-correction program feature is deprecated.

Member Error::program_type (ProgramType pt=undefined_prog_type)
The error-correction program feature is deprecated.

Member Error::set_program (char *program)
The error-correction program feature is deprecated.

Member Error::set_program_type (ProgramType pt=undefined_prog_type)
The error-correction program feature is deprecated.

Member Array::add_constraint (Pix p, int start, int stride, int stop)
Methods which use the Pix objects are deprecated in favor of the methods which use iterators.

Methods which use the Pix objects are deprecated in favor of the methods which use iterators.

Methods which use the Pix objects are deprecated in favor of the methods which use iterators.

Member Array::first_dim ()
Methods which use the Pix objects are deprecated in favor of the methods which use iterators.

Member Array::next_dim (Pix p)
Methods which use the Pix objects are deprecated. Use the methods which use iterators.

Member Array::print_decl (ostream &os, string space="", bool print_semi=true, bool constraint_info=false, bool constrained=false)
Use the FILE * interface.

Member Array::update_length (int size)
Calling this method should never be necessary. It is called whenever the size of the Array is changed.

Member AttrTable::find (const string &target, AttrTable **at)
All methods which use or return Pix objects are deprecated.

Member AttrTable::attr_alias (const string &alias, const string &name)
The current alias design is flawed. It is impossible to map this onto the XML implementation where the DAS and DDS information are combined in one object.

Member AttrTable::attr_alias (const string &alias, AttrTable *at, const string &name)
The current alias design is flawed. It is impossible to map this onto the XML implementation where the DAS and DDS information are combined in one object.

Member AttrTable::print (ostream &os, string pad="", bool dereference=false)
Using the C++ iostream class is deprecated.

Member AttrTable::simple_print (ostream &os, string pad, Attr_iter &i, bool dereference)
Using the C++ iostream class is deprecated in favor of the older C stdio code because of problem with some implementations of iostream and because our software needs to use FILE pointers for binary I/O. Using one I/O system simplifies the implementation. The prohibition against iostream extends only to the I/O which returns response objects (or may contribute to that) but in some places we've gone ahead and replaces iostream with stdio just to keep the code similar.

Member BaseType::print_decl (ostream &os, string space="", bool print_semi=true, bool constraint_info=false, bool constrained=false)
Use the version of this method which takes a FILE pointer.

Member BaseType::print_val (ostream &os, string space="", bool print_decl_p=true)=0
Using the C++ iostream class is deprecated.

Member BaseType::var (const string &n, btp_stack &s)
This method is deprecated because is tries first to use exact_match and, if that fails, then tries leaf_match. It's better to use the alternate form of var(...) and specify exactly what you'd like to do.

Member Connect::Connect (const string &name, bool www_verbose_errors, bool accept_deflate, string uname="", string password="")
Use the three-argument constructor instead.

Member DAS::print (ostream &os=cout, bool dereference=false)
Using the C++ iostream class is deprecated.

Member DDS::parse_constraint (const string &constraint, FILE *out, bool server=true)
This version requires the second param even though it's never used. Use the single argument version.

Member DDS::parse_constraint (const string &constraint, ostream &os, bool server=true)
Use the single argument version.

Member DDS::send (const string &dataset, const string &constraint, FILE *out, bool compressed=true, const string &cgi_ver="", time_t lmt=0)
Use method in DODSFilter instead. 07/24/03 jhrg

Member Error::Error (ErrorCode ec, string msg, ProgramType pt, char *pgm)
The error-correction program feature is deprecated.

Member Sequence::buf2val (void **val)

Member Sequence::print_all_vals (ostream &os, XDR *src, DDS *dds, string space="", bool print_decl_p=true)
Using the C++ iostream class is deprecated. Print the entire sequence.

Member Structure::first_var ()
All methods which use or return Pix objects are deprecated.

Member Structure::next_var (Pix p)
All methods which use or return Pix objects are deprecated.

Member Structure::print_all_vals (FILE *out, XDR *src, DDS *dds, string space="", bool print_decl_p=true)
This method was needed when Sequence::deserialize had different semantics than BaseType::deserialize (which was a really odd design because the Sequence is a descendant of the later...). But Sequence now deserializes in one call in this implementation so print() works as expected.

Member Structure::print_all_vals (ostream &os, XDR *src, DDS *dds, string space="", bool print_decl_p=true)
Using the C++ iostream class is deprecated.

Member Structure::var (Pix p)
use iterator operator * with the iterator returned from var_begin() to reference the element

Member do_data_transfer (bool compression, FILE *data_stream, DDS &dds, const string &dataset, const string &constraint)
Use DODSFilter's methods instead.

Using the C++ iostream class is deprecated.

Using the C++ iostream class is deprecated.

Member set_mime_not_modified (ostream &os)
Using the C++ iostream class is deprecated. Send a `Not Modified' response.
